definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: One of the best anime songs…
sentences.chinese: 八字年代的兒歌，是大人都啱聽的。

sentences.english: I alive to make money is not easy again, but rather to spend exactly the opposite.
sentences.chinese: 我再次感覺到搵錢唔容易，但喺用錢就啱啱相反。

sentences.english: I alive to make money is not easy again, but rather to spend exactly the opposite.
sentences.chinese: 我再次感覺到搵錢唔容易，但喺用錢就啱啱相反。

sentences.english: I want to know too, what's the problem of Raceface?
sentences.chinese: 裝得唔啱就有問題，我用左年幾冇事。

definition: old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)
to be at, in or on (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 在[zai4]
so (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 這樣|这样[zhe4 yang4]
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
Cantonese particle equivalent to 了[le5] or 過|过[guo4]
(literary) to wipe away (tears)/to press with one's fingers/to soak
what? (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]
to know/to reprimand/to urge/to long for/to tell/to inform
particle used for interjection (Cantonese)/see also 啫哩[zhe3 li1]
